newsitem.title: UK: Investors back US bid for UK's Energy - paper.
newsitem.headline: Investors back US bid for UK's Energy - paper.

text.p: A 3.6 billion pound agreed takeover of Britain's Energy Group by American utility PacifiCorp is expected early next week after the deal won approval from institutional investors, the Independent newspaper said.

The newspaper reported in its Thursday edition that around 12 U.S. and British institutions, including Norwich Union, Scottish Mutual, Morgan Grenfell, Schroders Plc, Clerical Medical and Merrill Lynch, were "thought to have indicated their backing" for the bid.

Energy Group, which includes Britain's biggest electricity supplier Eastern Electricity and U.S.- Australian coal producer Peabody, has been tipped as a takeover target since it was spun off from once mighty industrial conglomerate Hanson Plc in February.
And Pacificorp has been rumoured to be interested in Britain's cash-rich electricity sector for over a year. It is one of America's biggest utilities.
Energy's shares surged on Wednesday on hopes of a bid, valuing the group at 3.34 billion pounds, after it said late on Tuesday that it was in friendly takeover talks with the American giant.
